text: i run another script and its working but in the logs private app still doesn't appear:pensive:
I know it somewhat well, definitely not crazy about it though
trying to use the ads reporting api to filter campaign statistics to a specific company, but it is getting the me the total still

Hello friends, I'm not sure if this is the right place but I have contacts with multiple contact_ids in my HubSpot data. Apparently only one of them is valid. Is there a way to tell which contact id is no longer valid in the data. I get this page when I try to view those contacts. e.g. <https://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/001/contact/1234>
Is there a way to connect HubSpot payments with AutomatorWP? I know that HubSpot is powered by Stripe, but would love to know if I can get the API connection with the plugin for WP.
Update on this front — Still overall not working. However — It does work just perfectly if I only add one line item.

Dude this seems like a headbanger. Here’s my “have you checked your pockets?” question… _have you tried this in a clean dev portal with a simplified set up?_ Sometimes if I strip a project down I’ll find a common denominator

<@U3T21PDBK> Very frustrating indeed. <@U7SL518D6> had the great idea of using graphql to simply bring up all properties for quotes (genius!) since there are no docs on it that I can find. Leaving that nugget hidden here for all to absorb because it’s def not something I would have considered.

But Honestly, I don’t think I can simplify this any more. The flow seems to be “working” as everything is attached, properly. It all shows when you edit the actual quote. But something is still amiss somewhere haha
Why exactly do you need to bring up all the properties for the quote?

Well it’s just helpful to know for debugging. I can at least know what is all available to set and can see if something isnt getting set that isnt documented that should be getting set.

Overall it would have been nice to have early on. All that is documented currently is the minimal options needed to do the basic setup. Then the “get” for a quote has a properties key where you can specify what attributes to show… but they don’t tell you what you can actually grab.
Oh I always just use the /schemas endpoint
That's what I did before starting to help you
got it.
Hahaha  I GOT IT
thanks to GraphQL
`"hs_position_on_quote"` needs to be set when generating these line items.
YES!
If not set it is null. And does not auto increment for you until you manually load into the editor
Thanks for the help y’all!
youre welcome :laughing:
<https://media.giphy.com/media/6Q4mJ3Rs50vTSczSjo/giphy.gif>

Going to drop in, pretend I did something more useful than just going - Hey open the graphiql interface, pop in this query for line items, and see the properties…

And use that to promote this video on custom objects and importantly how to use graphQL in HubSpot:
<https://youtu.be/PzcvRL5MyDA>
:stuck_out_tongue:

I am using the HubSpot PHP SDK. We have recently moved to Private App API and I am now failing on
```->objectProperties('products')->all()->data```
I assume this needs something like crm.objects.products but I am not seeing that as an available scope. Is there any extension for those users who were on the legacy API Keys??

If it helps this is the endpoint that is giving error
```Client error: `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/properties/v2/products/properties?hapikey=***>` resulted in a `401 Unauthorized` response: {"status":"error","message":"The API key provided is invalid. View or manage your API key here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/> (truncated...)```

Does anyone know who we can talk to at HubSpot about missing features in the new APIs v/s Legacy?

For example the endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/communication-preferences/v3/status/email/> which looks to replace <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/subscriptions> does not have a businessUnitId returned. How are we supposed to support multiple brands using this newer API? With the looming November 30th request to update our keys, I am seeing many of the older legacy API calls (in production systems) simply are not supported with the private app keys.
I struggled with that as well <@U03CLHSPMF1>, i was told the support staff are “not trained on the API”. We ended up using custom properties and workflows for our issue. Hope you can find a solution
